Description: Fragment of lip and cul of early Chian pottery patterned chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with trace of two added white bands; exterior reserved with group of vertical strokes between brown bands in handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), Buried in sand under the west wall of Temenos.
Curator's comments: If this is a dedication to the Dioskouroi and is still of seventh century date it becomes the earliest evidence for that cult. But the two suppositions cannot be assured.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXV, no. 679)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0317) (phase 2)
